content.description: <math alttext="C O C l 2 gas is in equilibrium with C O gas plus C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>COCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>CO(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: At a given temperature, the system represented by the chemical equation above is at equilibrium inside a rigid container. Which of the following explains how the system will restore equilibrium, based on the correct relationship between <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, after a certain amount of <math alttext="C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is added?

choices.label: Since <math alttext="Q equals the fraction the molar concentration of C l 2 times the molar concentration of C O over the molar concentration of C O C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>][</mtext><mtext>CO</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>COCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="Q is greater than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when <math alttext="C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to the system; the system will restore equilibrium by producing more <math alttext="C O C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>COCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Since <math alttext="Q equals the fraction of the molar concentration of C l 2 times the molar concentration of C O over the molar concentration of C O C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>][</mtext><mtext>CO</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>COCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="Q is less than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo><</mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when <math alttext="C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to the system; the system will restore equilibrium by producing more <math alttext="C O gas" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>CO(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></math>.

Since <math alttext="Q equals the fraction of the molar concentration of C O C l 2 over the molar concentration of C O times the molar concentration of C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>COCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>CO</mtext><mtext>][</mtext><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="Q is greater than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when <math alttext="C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to the system; the system will restore equilibrium by producing more <math alttext="C O C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>COCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Since <math alttext="Q equals the fraction of the molar concentration of C O C l 2 over the molar concentration of C O times the molar concentration of C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>COCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>CO</mtext><mtext>][</mtext><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="Q is greater than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when <math alttext="C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to the system; the system will restore equilibrium by producing more <math alttext="C O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Since <math alttext="Q equals the fraction the molar concentration of C l 2 times the molar concentration of C O over the molar concentration of C O C l 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>][</mtext><mtext>CO</mtext><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>COCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="Q is greater than K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi><mo>></mo><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> when <math alttext="C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to the system; the system will restore equilibrium by producing more <math alttext="C O C l 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>COCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 7.10: Reaction Quotient and Le Châtelier's Principle

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
